conclusion: To determine which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles, we need to analyze the flow paths of each colored liquid as shown in the images.
The blue liquid flows from A, passes through the baffle, and curves towards container E.
The teal liquid flows from B, passes through the baffle, and curves towards container E.
The yellow liquid flows from C, passes through the baffle, and curves towards container F.
The orange liquid flows from D, passes through the baffle, and curves towards container F.
The baffle seems to redirect the liquid's flow path, but only slightly, not enough to change the intended direction significantly.
The redirection occurs predominantly where the arrows indicate on the baffles.
The blue and teal liquids, after passing through the baffle, continue their path horizontally and curve towards container E.
The yellow and orange liquids also pass through the baffle and continue their trajectory horizontally but curve towards container F.
The blue and teal liquids will flow into container E.
The yellow and orange liquids will flow into container F.
Container E receives the blue and teal liquids, and container F receives the yellow and orange liquids.
